description: I really enjoy the puzzley nature of moving my dice and predicting other players actions. A very fun dice mitigation experience.

title: I dread te...
description: I dread teaching this one, but once everyone gets a couple of rounds under their belt they at least understand the dice mechanic, even if mastery of role selection takes longer. It would be nice to play this a couple of times in quick succession to really cement the rules.Probably a bit tricky for children, due to the confusing role selection mechanic and strategies for engine building.

description: Chopping Block

title: I'm basica...
description: I'm basically done with Race for the Galaxy, but I could be entertained by Roll for the Galaxy another time or two.

title: 2-5 player...
description: 2-5 players, c. 45 minutes, tableau buildingHave played almost a dozen games and I really like this game quite a bit. Not necessarily better then Race for the Galaxy, but certainly a good game and the dice work really well. Downside is that people play behind their screens, so you will need to be able to trust them.

title: One play a...
description: One play and I was hooked. This game is Fantastic! SO MANY DICE! So good!

title: One of my ...
description: One of my all time favorites! Dice, space, worker placement!

title: So far I q...
description: So far I quite like this - it's a very nice re-envisioning of RftG as a dice game.

title: Highly rec...
description: Highly recommend Ambition expansion to make it more fun. Without it, it seems very lacking.

title: Expansions...
description: Expansions Owned: Ambition

title: I dunno, m...
description:
I dunno, man. It's... weird. I'd probably find it less weird if I haven't played Race 100+ times, but it'd still be weird. Perhaps I'll have something more coherent to say after playing some more.
[EDIT] Grappling with the dice system is initially daunting, but eventually you get into the rhythm. I am a bit concerned that shipping is necessary for victory, but I am ready to declare that the game is solidly good.
It's definitely less open that Race, though--a strong dice-cycling system is a must.

title: Expansions...
description:
Expansions:
- Ambition
- Rivalry

Satisfying dice rolls with dice cups provided in each player colour and an assortment of coloured mini dice as workers.

Doesn't take too long to play, for what it is. Simultaneous turns are always a bonus because they keep the flow moving at a good pace regardless of player count.

title: I suspect ...
description: I suspect that this will, over time, grow on me in much the same way that Race for the Galaxy did. I like the mechanism where you add more options through specialized dice over the course of the game. Quite clever. There's a real game in here, certainly.

title: Nice twist...
description: Nice twist on a deck builder by swapping cards for dice.  Plays quick but still offers lots of tough decisions.  I like the mechanic of selecting which action you want to play after the dice are rolled while opponents do the same and only selected action dice are retained while the rest are sent back to the cup which adds a fun element of 'game theory'.

title: Better tha...
description: Better than Race, that's for sure. I (surprisingly) like the dice element, specifically choosing what roles to select. That part of the game is great; the tableau building not so much. Basically, I like the new stuff, still hate the old stuff.

title: Played thi...
description: Played this in only one session, but since playing I have not been able to stop thinking about the game. This could become a favourite.

title: Been playi...
description: Been playing a bunch on BGA

title: I love dic...
description: I love dice, what can I say... The game is easy, fast paced, fun and overall a great game to begin a gaming night

title:
FOR SALE
F...
description:
FOR SALE
FOR TRADE

A nice 'update' to Race for the Galaxy, which we also enjoy. The dice a fun to play with and provide a nicely different gaming experience. Unfortunately, it also makes the game too unwieldy to travel. Fun game.

title: Elegant, f...
description: Elegant, fast and very thinky for it's size.  Some prefer Race, some Roll.  Try both!

description: I haven't played the original, but this one isn't ad daunting to teach so I probably won't go back to Race.

title: Fantastic,...
description: Fantastic, nearly perfect strategy. Space empire theme is fun, the colorful tiny dice are exciting. Sometimes a tad *too* solitaire-y. One of my favorite games.
